item.title: Rosebud lands $6M to scale its interactive AI journaling app
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Journaling app Rosebud has raised $6 million in seed funding as it seeks to flesh out its app as an AI mentor for self-reflection and personal growth.

item.title: Bolttech closes Series C at $147M with a $2.1B valuation to bolster its embedded insurance offerings
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Singapore-based embedded insurance startup Bolttech has closed a $147 million Series C round of funding at a $2.1 billion valuation.

item.title: Uber adds a new type of account with a simpler UI for the elderly
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Uber today revealed a new type of account, called Senior Accounts, for older users that prioritizes a simpler app experience.

item.title: Apple names 2025 Design Awards winners
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Apple has named 12 apps across six categories for this year's Design Awards.

item.title: One of Africa’s most successful founders is back with a new AI startup and already raised $9M
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: In 2023, co-founders Karim Jouini and Jihed Othmani sold their expense management startup Expensya to Swedish procurement software firm Medius in what is widely considered to be one of the largest acquisitions of an African startup. Some sources say the sum was just over $120 million, although deal terms were not disclosed. Success achieved, both […]

item.title: Windsurf says Anthropic is limiting its direct access to Claude AI models
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Windsurf, the popular vibe coding startup that’s reportedly being acquired by OpenAI, says Anthropic significantly reduced its first-party access to its Claude 3.7 Sonnet and Claude 3.5 Sonnet AI models. Windsurf CEO Varun Mohan said in a post on X Tuesday that Anthropic gave Windsurf little notice for this change, and the startup now has […]

item.title: Anthropic’s AI is writing its own blog — with human oversight
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Anthropic has given its AI a blog. A week ago, Anthropic quietly launched Claude Explains, a new page on its website that’s generated mostly by the company’s AI model family, Claude. Populated by posts on technical topics related to various Claude use cases (e.g. “Simplify complex codebases with Claude”), the blog is intended to be […]

item.title: Now Deel is accusing Rippling of spying by ‘impersonating’ a customer
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Deel alleges that one of Rippling’s employees "spent six months impersonating a legitimate Deel customer to gain unauthorized access to Deel’s systems to meticulously analyze, record, and copy Deel’s global products and the way Deel does business for Rippling’s own benefit and use.”

item.title: Google places another fusion power bet on TAE Technologies
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: TAE Technologies raised $150 million from investors including Google, Chevron, and others.

item.title: The OpenAI board drama is reportedly turning into a movie
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: A film that will portray the chaotic time at OpenAI, when co-founder and CEO Sam Altman was fired and rehired within a span of just five days, is reportedly in the works. According to The Hollywood Reporter, the movie is titled “Artificial,” and it’s in development at Amazon MGM Studios. While details aren’t finalized, sources […]

item.title: Phone chipmaker Qualcomm fixes three zero-days exploited by hackers
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Google's Threat Analysis Group, which investigates government-backed hacks, was credited with the discovery of the zero-days.

item.title: Colossal Labs will release the sounds of dire wolves howling ‘later this year,’ founder says
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The company is working on a bio-acoustic project, which will map out the different types of dire wolf howls.

item.title: Hinge CMO Jackie Jantos hopes to help make Gen Zers less lonely
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Hinge CMO and President Jackie Jantos chats about how Hinge is marketing itself to a new generation in what has become a listless dating scene.

item.title: Reddit now lets you hide content, like posts and comments, from your user profile
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Reddit says it's rolling out an update that will introduce a "Content and Activity" setting that allows users to decide which content from the subreddits they participate in will appear on their profiles. This includes both their posting and commenting history.

item.title: Yoshua Bengio launches LawZero, a nonprofit AI safety lab
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Turing Award winner Yoshua Bengio is launching a nonprofit AI safety lab called LawZero to build safer AI systems, he told the Financial Times on Monday. LawZero raised $30 million in philanthropic contributions from Skype founding engineer Jaan Tallinn, former Google chief Eric Schmidt, Open Philanthropy, and the Future of Life Institute, among others. The […]

item.title: Meta buys a nuclear power plant (more or less)
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Meta and Constellation Energy said the deal would help keep the Clinton Clean Energy Center running through 2047 without ratepayer support.

item.title: TikTok rolls out AI-powered Smart Keyword Filters to limit content you don’t want to see
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: While TikTok already allows users to use keyword filters to restrict specific content from appearing in their feeds, the new Smart Keyword Filters will use AI to additionally limit content that contains similar keywords, such as synonyms.

item.title: DeepSeek may have used Google’s Gemini to train its latest model
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: DeepSeek didn't reveal the source of the data it used to train the updated version of its R1 reasoning AI model, but some AI researchers speculate that at least a portion came from Google's Gemini family of AI.

item.title: Snap adds new tools for building Bitmoji games
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Snapchat is launching new Lens Studio tools that AR creators and developers can use to build Bitmoji games.

item.title: Indian grocery startup KiranaPro was hacked and its servers deleted, CEO confirms
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The company said the cyberattack destroyed its servers and customer data.
